required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MRG002 in the Treatment of Patients With HER2-low Locally Advanced or Metastatic Breast Cancer (BC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Non-randomized, Open-label Phase II Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of MRG002 in the Treatment of Patients With HER2-low Locally Advanced or Metastatic Breast Cancer (BC)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess the safety, efficacy, pharmacokinetics, and immunogenicity of MRG002 in patients with HER2-low locally advanced or metastatic BC.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be conducted in two parts. The first part is efficacy exploration and the second part is efficacy verification. During the course of efficacy exploration, 33 subjects will be enrolled to preliminarily evaluate the safety and efficacy of MRG002. The second part will be adjusted according to the result of the first part. 29 subjects are planned to be enrolled. Considering the dropout rate of 10%, approximately 33 subjects are planned to be enrolled. A total of 66 subjects are planned to be enrolled in efficacy exploration and verification.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) by Independent Review Committee(IRC)
primary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the proportions of subjects with a complete response (CR) and partial response (PR). ORR will be assessed by Independent Review Committee (IRC) according to RECIST v1.1.

secondary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the proportions of subjects with a complete response (CR) and partial response (PR). ORR will be assessed by investigator according to RECIST v1.1.
PFS was defined as the duration from the start of treatment to the onset of tumor progression or death of any cause.
The proportions of subjects surviving without progression from the start of treatment to 6-month and 12-month duration.
TTR was defined as the duration from the start of treatment to the first onset of CR or PR in tumor evaluation.
DOR was defined as the duration from the initial recording of objective disease response to the first onset of tumor progression, or death of any cause.
DCR was defined as the proportions of subjects achieving CR, PR, and stable disease (SD) after treatment.
OS was defined as the duration from the start of treatment to death of any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 30 days after the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of AEs and serious adverse events (SAEs) will be assessed based on NCI-CTCAE v5.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) parameter for MRG002: concentration-time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 14 days after decision to discontinue treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration-time curve will be depicted based on pharmacokinetics concentration set (PKCS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 14 days after decision to discontinue treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of anti-drug antibody (ADA) analysis will be summarized for all patients who received at least one cycle study treatment.

arm_group.description: MRG002 will be administrated via intravenous infusion of 2.6 mg/kg once on Day 1 of every 3 weeks (21-day cycle).

overall_official.affiliation: Fifth Medical Center of PLA General Hospital
The Fourth Hospital of Hebei Medical University
